meanings.definition: The quality or state of being solvable.
meanings.sent1: The solvability of the math problem made it easy to find the answer.
meanings.sent2: The solvability of the puzzle was evident once all the pieces were in place.
meanings.sent3: The solvability of the riddle brought smiles to the puzzled faces.
meanings.sent4: Her determination increased the solvability of the mystery that had stumped many.
meanings.sent5: The solvability of the equation shone brightly in the student's mind.

meanings.definition: The ability to be solved or resolved.
meanings.sent1: The detective's skill in assessing solvability of cases was unmatched.
meanings.sent2: The solvability of the conflict depended on open communication between the parties.
meanings.sent3: The solvability of the problem seemed to dance just out of reach, teasingly.
meanings.sent4: The solvability of the issue was like a light at the end of a dark tunnel.
meanings.sent5: The solvability of the mystery was finally revealed in the last chapter of the book.
